intro: Psychotria peduncularis var. semlikiensis, commonly known as the Semliki psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a glossy surface and are arranged alternately along the stem. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
